title: West Elm Dropped Black Friday Deals on Thousands of Items — Shop Our Top Picks
description: Prices start at just $20. READ MORE...
author: Nikol Slatinska
text: DecoratingFurnitureShoppingpublished about 4 hours agoWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.As busy as this season can be, all of the mayhem is worth it when late December finally arrives, your loved ones receive their gifts, and your home looks as beautiful and festive as you’ve always envisioned. A lovely setup is more than attainable; you just have to get your furniture and decor shopping done a little early. Fortunately, that’s never been easier, considering almost all of our favorite home retailers have begun their Black Friday sales early this year.Right now, you can save on your dream coffee maker, new linens for your bed, and even big ticket items, like sofas. But the shopping event we’ve been waiting for all year is finally here, and that’s West Elm’s Black Friday sale. Right now, the brand is offering up to 50% off thousands of items, including furniture, decor, and stylish storage solutions. You’ll find 10 of our favorites below, including a handful of editor-tested finds you don’t want to pass up.1 / 10West Elm$909.30was $1199.00Available in three lengths up to 86 inches, West Elm’s editor-tested Andes Sofa comes in truly pint-size proportions. I love that you can customize the sofa to your space and style — the number of made-to-order fabric options is impressive. You also have a choice between dark or brass legs.2 / 10West Elm$34.99was $49.00Save vanity space by storing necklaces, sunglasses, and other accessories on this cute wooden wall organizer. It can be mounted using adhesive strips and is therefore totally renter-friendly. Plus, it features a cork board on which you can tack photos and other mementos.3 / 10West Elm$159.20was $199.00Quilts are the perfect all-season bedding staple. In the summer, they can stand on their own in place of a heavy comforter, and in the winter, you can layer them up. This stunning set is made of breathable European flax and on sale in two colors. You’ll find that its material gets softer with every wash.4 / 10West Elm$399.20was $499.00If you're looking to add a glam touch to your living space and display your favorite decor without putting up a new bookshelf, the mid-century art display coffee table has you covered. It’s a solid choice for both small-space dwellers, too. I love its glass top, gold-toned legs, and walnut undershelf.5 / 10West Elm$319.20was $399.00Another piece I reviewed for our Personal Shopper series, the Kai flatweave rug is on sale in a beautiful marigold color. I was instantly drawn to its handwoven motif and distressed finish, as well as its sturdy construction. The low-pile rug is made to withstand heavy foot traffic, thanks to its blend of wool, jute, and cotton. It’s perfect for the dining room, kitchen, or front entryway.6 / 10West Elm$1839.20was $2199.00Of all the beds I looked at in West Elm’s brick-and-mortar store, the Lana was my favorite. I was instantly taken with its blush-pink fabric and curved headboard. The only thing that could make it better would be a couple of storage drawers, and luckily, West Elm delivered on that front! This pick is modern without looking too harsh thanks to its rounded lines, and it's also bound to be a massive compliment-getter.7 / 10West Elm$191.20was $239.00Senior Style Editor, Blair, says this floor lamp's clear glass shade adds tons of brightness to her living room — even from its spot behind the couch. “This lamp has been with me through two moves and one VERY tiny apartment — proof that it’s absolutely perfect for small, tight corners in any space,” she added. The angled globe head further adds visual interest to this striking piece.8 / 10West Elm$319.20was $399.00West Elm’s Penn Chair just screams cozy, doesn’t it? Thick cushions and high arms make for a comfortable sit, while the soft velvet finish and bold metal legs give it just enough flair. According to Commerce SEO Writer Haley, the chair made her friend’s small apartment feel more inviting. “She loves it — it was exactly what her empty corner was missing," Haley says in her review. "It’s the ideal blend of an accent chair and something she’ll actually use, not just for show.”9 / 10West Elm$20.00was $25.00Why have your sticks of butter just sitting out on the fridge shelf or dining table in their wax paper when you can store them inside this snazzy stoneware dish, instead? The Kaloh dish not only keeps your butter safe from the elements, but its sleek design and shiny glaze will also add an elegant touch to your holiday tablescape. And, at $20, the dish is a steal.10 / 10West Elm$519.20was $649.00Simple and serene, the elegant Santa Rosa dining table seats up to four people and fits in tight dining rooms where larger tables might not. The natural wood grain has a Driftwood Gray finish that complements a range of decor schemes, while the cross base adds an architectural flair.
html:
• Decorating
  • Furniture
  • Shopping

published about 4 hours ago

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

As busy as this season can be, all of the mayhem is worth it when late December finally arrives, your loved ones receive their gifts, and your home looks as beautiful and festive as you’ve always envisioned. A lovely setup is more than attainable; you just have to get your furniture and decor shopping done a little early. Fortunately, that’s never been easier, considering almost all of our favorite home retailers have begun their Black Friday sales early this year.

Right now, you can save on your dream coffee maker, new linens for your bed, and even big ticket items, like sofas. But the shopping event we’ve been waiting for all year is finally here, and that’s West Elm’s Black Friday sale. Right now, the brand is offering up to 50% off thousands of items, including furniture, decor, and stylish storage solutions. You’ll find 10 of our favorites below, including a handful of editor-tested finds you don’t want to pass up.

1 / 10

West Elm

$909.30

was $1199.00

Available in three lengths up to 86 inches, West Elm’s editor-tested Andes Sofa comes in truly pint-size proportions. I love that you can customize the sofa to your space and style — the number of made-to-order fabric options is impressive. You also have a choice between dark or brass legs.

2 / 10

West Elm

$34.99

was $49.00

Save vanity space by storing necklaces, sunglasses, and other accessories on this cute wooden wall organizer. It can be mounted using adhesive strips and is therefore totally renter-friendly. Plus, it features a cork board on which you can tack photos and other mementos.

3 / 10

West Elm

$159.20

was $199.00

Quilts are the perfect all-season bedding staple. In the summer, they can stand on their own in place of a heavy comforter, and in the winter, you can layer them up. This stunning set is made of breathable European flax and on sale in two colors. You’ll find that its material gets softer with every wash.

4 / 10

West Elm

$399.20

was $499.00

If you're looking to add a glam touch to your living space and display your favorite decor without putting up a new bookshelf, the mid-century art display coffee table has you covered. It’s a solid choice for both small-space dwellers, too. I love its glass top, gold-toned legs, and walnut undershelf.

5 / 10

West Elm

$319.20

was $399.00

Another piece I reviewed for our Personal Shopper series, the Kai flatweave rug is on sale in a beautiful marigold color. I was instantly drawn to its handwoven motif and distressed finish, as well as its sturdy construction. The low-pile rug is made to withstand heavy foot traffic, thanks to its blend of wool, jute, and cotton. It’s perfect for the dining room, kitchen, or front entryway.

6 / 10

West Elm

$1839.20

was $2199.00

Of all the beds I looked at in West Elm’s brick-and-mortar store, the Lana was my favorite. I was instantly taken with its blush-pink fabric and curved headboard. The only thing that could make it better would be a couple of storage drawers, and luckily, West Elm delivered on that front! This pick is modern without looking too harsh thanks to its rounded lines, and it's also bound to be a massive compliment-getter.

7 / 10

West Elm

$191.20

was $239.00

Senior Style Editor, Blair, says this floor lamp's clear glass shade adds tons of brightness to her living room — even from its spot behind the couch. “This lamp has been with me through two moves and one VERY tiny apartment — proof that it’s absolutely perfect for small, tight corners in any space,” she added. The angled globe head further adds visual interest to this striking piece.

8 / 10

West Elm

$319.20

was $399.00

West Elm’s Penn Chair just screams cozy, doesn’t it? Thick cushions and high arms make for a comfortable sit, while the soft velvet finish and bold metal legs give it just enough flair. According to Commerce SEO Writer Haley, the chair made her friend’s small apartment feel more inviting. “She loves it — it was exactly what her empty corner was missing," Haley says in her review. "It’s the ideal blend of an accent chair and something she’ll actually use, not just for show.”

9 / 10

West Elm

$20.00

was $25.00

Why have your sticks of butter just sitting out on the fridge shelf or dining table in their wax paper when you can store them inside this snazzy stoneware dish, instead? The Kaloh dish not only keeps your butter safe from the elements, but its sleek design and shiny glaze will also add an elegant touch to your holiday tablescape. And, at $20, the dish is a steal.

10 / 10

West Elm

$519.20

was $649.00

Simple and serene, the elegant Santa Rosa dining table seats up to four people and fits in tight dining rooms where larger tables might not. The natural wood grain has a Driftwood Gray finish that complements a range of decor schemes, while the cross base adds an architectural flair.
